Sentencas: In this work, an online natural aging estimation algorithm is developed, coupled with an Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy (EIS)-based diagnostic algorithm, to refine detection features extraction during Solid Oxide Fuel Cell (SOFC) stack operation and to predict its Remaining Useful Life (RUL).
Titulo: Coupling electrochemical impedance spectroscopy and model-based aging estimation for solid oxide fuel cell stacks lifetime prediction

Sentencas: A combination of a lumped dynamic model along with features extracted from real-time EIS measurements is herein proposed for online applications.
Titulo: Coupling electrochemical impedance spectroscopy and model-based aging estimation for solid oxide fuel cell stacks lifetime prediction

Sentencas: An Equivalent Circuit Model (ECM) is considered to identify parameters, such as ohmic and total resistance, that are coupled with an Area Specific Resistance (ASR) approach within the lumped model.
Titulo: Coupling electrochemical impedance spectroscopy and model-based aging estimation for solid oxide fuel cell stacks lifetime prediction

Sentencas: The information derived from the EIS spectrum allows to estimate the voltage degradation over time along with its nominal behaviour.
Titulo: Coupling electrochemical impedance spectroscopy and model-based aging estimation for solid oxide fuel cell stacks lifetime prediction

Sentencas: Indeed, the time trend of the identified parameters is proportional to the aging of the cell if no other abnormal condition occurs.
Titulo: Coupling electrochemical impedance spectroscopy and model-based aging estimation for solid oxide fuel cell stacks lifetime prediction

Sentencas: This guarantees an on-line RUL estimation and a more robust diagnostic algorithm for fault detection and isolation.
Titulo: Coupling electrochemical impedance spectroscopy and model-based aging estimation for solid oxide fuel cell stacks lifetime prediction

Sentencas: The approach has been applied to a 6-cells anode supported short stack tested for about 5000 h, and the related RUL estimation identified a critical issue on the middle cell, affecting its neighbours.
Titulo: Coupling electrochemical impedance spectroscopy and model-based aging estimation for solid oxide fuel cell stacks lifetime prediction
